text:
Question: Apartment dwellers, how do you deal with the quirks of living so close to others?

Question description: so ive been living in this flat for a bit, and recently got new neighbours. they're alright, but their dog has this super weird loud bark that sounds like a person saying "hello" in a really hoarse voice. scared the bejeezus out of me the first night I heard it, not gonna lie. made me think there's a ghost or smth lurking around lol. got me thinking though, everyone who's lived in an apartment's got some weird or funny story to tell about their neighbours or thin walls. what's your wild story from living stacked up like canned sardines?
student loans hit differently once you're paying them off
def felt grown-up balancing rent & coding deadlines alone
ha gotta say waking up at 3am realizing there’s a fix for your code does wonders for your sleep pattern — coffee’s basically my new bestie
funny that because now i'm always automating mundane stuff at home too... if i can script it, why do it manually? cuts down chore time so i can binge-watch another series lol
getting into drills at work means now i catch myself running mental debug scenarios over my morning coffee instead of actually relaxing 😂 kind of trades one stress for another huh?
mate it's mad how fast they swap expecting nights out for investment chats once you hit big three-o -- as if binging netflix isn’t valid downtime anymore!
love's more like finding your player two tbh
hard work beats fate imo - no fairy tale but definitely a shared spreadsheet for bills & takeout orders 🙃
having someone who's got your back can be reassuring - it’s finding balance between 'me time' & 'we time', isn't easy but worth it when you strike it right
spot-on - growing up kind seems like leveling up together in co-op mode; not so much player one has entered the game anymore
